page.title: 03Education in Scremerston.
page.content: The first school in Scremerston was a {National School}built in 1843.It was for 150 children and cost Â£400 to build,the average attendance was 130 and children were taught there until they were 14. After 1944 the children transferred at 11+ to{Berwick Grammar {School}providing they had passed an examination and if not to{Tweedmouth {County Secondary School. In 1964 a new{ Primary School}was built for up to 90 children. In 1974 the educational system in the County was re-organised along Comprehensive lines and the school became a First School for children from 5 to 9 years At first they transferred at 9+ to { {Tweedmouth Middle School}but since 1980 have transferred to{Berwick {Middle School.}At 13+ they then transfer to{Berwick High}School.Today there are 2 teachers and 50 children.
